org.wtc.eclipse.platform.helpers
Interface IProjectHelper

public interface IProjectHelper

Helper for creating and manipulating projects.

                               java.lang.String sourceProject,
                               java.lang.String targetProject)
addProjectBuildDependency - Open the project properties for a given project and add a project dependency to another given project.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input

addProjectNatureViaAPI

void addProjectNatureViaAPI(IUIContext ui,
                            java.lang.String projectName,
                            java.lang.String natureID)
addProjectNatureViaAPI - Use the Eclipse API to add a project nature to the project with the given name.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - Name of the project to add the nature to
natureID - - The ID of the nature (as determined by the the nature's declaring plugin.xml)

closeProject

void closeProject(IUIContext ui,
                  java.lang.String projectName)
closeProject - Use the navigator view to close a project in the workspace. This method will issue a test case failure if the project cannot be found for any reason. If the project is already closed, this operation is a no-op.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - Name of the project to close

exportProjectsToArchive

IPath exportProjectsToArchive(IUIContext ui,
                              java.lang.String[] projectNames,
                              java.lang.String archiveName)
exportProjectsToArchive - Export the projects in the workspace with the given names to an archive file with the given name. The archive will be placed in a directory under new directory that is a peer to the workspace (the archive cannot be put in the results directory because it conflicts with the workspace root) and returned as a disk-absolute location IPath. This method will issue a test case failure if any of the projects selected could not be found or exported for any reason.

Parameters:
ui - - Drive for UI generated input
projectNames - - The names of the projects in the workspace to export. The list should not be empty and the named projects should exist in the workspace
archiveName - - The short name of the archive to export the projects to. Ex: "ExportProjectsTest"
Returns:
IPath - The absolute disk location of the exported archive

getAllWorkspaceProjects

java.util.List<IProject> getAllWorkspaceProjects(IUIContext ui)
getAllWorkspaceProjects - Get all of the projects in the workspace.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
Returns:
List - The list of all the project objects in the current workspace or an empty list if no projects exist

getProjectForName

IProject getProjectForName(java.lang.String projectName)
getProjectForName - Get the workspace project for the given name.

Parameters:
projectName - - Should adhere to project name validation rules (not null, not the empty string, legal characters, etc)

getWorkspaceProjectNames

java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getWorkspaceProjectNames()
getWorkspaceProjectNames - Get a list of string project names for all projects in the active workspace.

Returns:
List - List of project names or an empty list if no projects exist

importExistingProjectFromArchive

void importExistingProjectFromArchive(IUIContext ui,
                                      Plugin sourcePlugin,
                                      IPath archivePath,
                                      java.lang.String projectName)
importExistingProjectFromArchive - Import an existing project in an archive into the current workspace. THIS METHOD SHOULD NOT TYPICALLY BE USED TO CREATE PROEJCTS IN THE WORKSPACE. INSTEAD, THE createNewProject() METHODS ON SPECIFIC PROJECT HELPERS SHOULD BE USED

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePlugin - - The test plugin containing the archive with the project to import
archivePath - - The plugin-relative path to the archive with the project to import
projectName - - The name of the project to import

importExistingProjectFromArchive

void importExistingProjectFromArchive(IUIContext ui,
                                      Plugin sourcePlugin,
                                      IPath archivePath,
                                      java.lang.String projectName,
                                      long timeout)
importExistingProjectFromArchive - Import an existing project in an archive into the current workspace. THIS METHOD SHOULD NOT TYPICALLY BE USED TO CREATE PROEJCTS IN THE WORKSPACE. INSTEAD, THE createNewProject() METHODS ON SPECIFIC PROJECT HELPERS SHOULD BE USED

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePlugin - - The test plugin containing the archive with the project to import
archivePath - - The plugin-relative path to the archive with the project to import
projectName - - The name of the project to import
timeout - - The number of milliseconds to wait for the import to finish. Must be larger than the default 60000

importExistingProjectFromSource

void importExistingProjectFromSource(IUIContext ui,
                                     Plugin sourcePlugin,
                                     IPath projectRootPath,
                                     java.lang.String projectName)
importExistingProjectFromSource - Import an existing project from a source location into the current workspace. Since imported projects will typically need to have read/write permissions, first copy the files into a folder under the current workspace directory, then import from that copied location. THIS METHOD SHOULD NOT TYPICALLY BE USED TO CREATE PROEJCTS IN THE WORKSPACE. INSTEAD, THE createNewProject() METHODS ON SPECIFIC PROJECT HELPERS SHOULD BE USED

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePlugin - - The test plugin containing the project source to import
projectRoot - - The plugin-relative path to the project to import. The folder must have a .project file as a first-level child. The folder should be named the same name as the name defined in the .project file.
projectName - - The name of the project to import

importExistingProjectFromSource

void importExistingProjectFromSource(IUIContext ui,
                                     Plugin sourcePlugin,
                                     IPath projectRootPath,
                                     java.lang.String projectName,
                                     long timeout)
importExistingProjectFromSource - Import an existing project from a source location into the current workspace. Since imported projects will typically need to have read/write permissions, first copy the files into a folder under the current workspace directory, then import from that copied location. THIS METHOD SHOULD NOT TYPICALLY BE USED TO CREATE PROEJCTS IN THE WORKSPACE. INSTEAD, THE createNewProject() METHODS ON SPECIFIC PROJECT HELPERS SHOULD BE USED

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePlugin - - The test plugin containing the project source to import
projectRoot - - The plugin-relative path to the project to import. The folder must have a .project file as a first-level child. The folder should be named the same name as the name defined in the .project file.
projectName - - The name of the project to import
timeout - - The number of milliseconds to wait for the import to finish. Must be larger than the default 60000

importExistingProjectsFromArchive

void importExistingProjectsFromArchive(IUIContext ui,
                                       Plugin sourcePlugin,
                                       IPath archivePath)
importExistingProjectsFromArchive - Import all projects in an archive into the current workspace. THIS METHOD SHOULD NOT TYPICALLY BE USED TO CREATE PROEJCTS IN THE WORKSPACE. INSTEAD, THE createNewProject() METHODS ON SPECIFIC PROJECT HELPERS SHOULD BE USED

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePlugin - - The test plugin containing the archive with the project to import
archivePath - - The plugin-relative path to the archive with the project to import

                                       IPath archivePath,
                                       long timeout)
importExistingProjectsFromArchive - Import all projects in an archive into the current workspace. THIS METHOD SHOULD NOT TYPICALLY BE USED TO CREATE PROEJCTS IN THE WORKSPACE. INSTEAD, THE createNewProject() METHODS ON SPECIFIC PROJECT HELPERS SHOULD BE USED

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePlugin - - The test plugin containing the archive with the project to import
archivePath - - The plugin-relative path to the archive with the project to import
timeout - - The number of milliseconds to wait for the import to finish. Must be larger than the default 60000

invokeProjectPropertiesDialog

void invokeProjectPropertiesDialog(IUIContext ui,
                                   java.lang.String projectName)
invokeProjecPropertiesDialog - Show the properties dialog for the project with the given name.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - The project whose properties dialog is to be shown

openProject

void openProject(IUIContext ui,
                 java.lang.String projectName)
openProject - Use the navigator view to open a project in the workspace. This method will issue a test case failure if the project cannot be found for any reason. If the project is already opened, this operation is a no-op.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - Name of the project to open

waitForProjectExists

void waitForProjectExists(IUIContext ui,
                          java.lang.String projectName,
                          boolean exists)
waitForProjectExists - Wait for the project with the given name to exist.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - Should not be null
exists - - True if the project should exist for this condition to be met

waitForProjectExists

void waitForProjectExists(IUIContext ui,
                          java.lang.String projectName,
                          boolean exists,
                          long timeout,
                          int interval)
waitForProjectExists - Wait for the project with the given name to exist (IF YOU AREN'T SURE WHAT THE TIMEOUT AND INTERVAL VALUES ARE SUPPOSED TO BE, THEN YOU SHOULDN'T BE USING THIS METHOD).

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - Should not be null
exists - - True if the project should exist for this condition to be met
timeout - - How long to wait before issuing a test case failure if the condition is not met
interval - - How long to wait between each test of the condition

waitForProjectOpen

void waitForProjectOpen(IUIContext ui,
                        java.lang.String projectName,
                        boolean open)
waitForProjectOpen - Wait for the project with the given name to exist and to have the given open/closed state.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - Should not be null
open - - True if the project should exist and be open for this condition to be met; false if the project should exist and be closed for this condition to be met
